title: Bootstrap: Initial Workspace Activation
body:
Purpose: Provide a clean agent the first actionable steps to safely enable catalog mutation.

Steps (agent-facing):
1. Call tool 'bootstrap/request' to obtain a one-time confirmation token (raw token returned once; only hash persisted). Optionally pass rationale.
2. Present the rationale + token verbatim to the human operator for explicit approval.
3. When approved, call tool 'bootstrap/confirmFinalize' with the token.
4. After confirmation succeeds (or if workspace already contained non-bootstrap instructions), proceed to add domain instructions using dispatcher action add (tools/call name='instructions/dispatch', arguments.action='add').
5. Use help/overview for lifecycle & promotion guidance; keep governance markdown outside the runtime catalog.
6. Periodically call 'bootstrap/status' and 'instructions/health' to verify confirmation + recursionRisk remains 'none'.

Workspace State Matrix:
- Reference Mode (MCP_REFERENCE_MODE=1): Read-only forever; all mutations blocked even after finalize attempts.
- Fresh (only bootstrap seeds present, no confirmation file): mutation_blocked with reason=bootstrap_confirmation_required.
- Pending (token issued, not finalized): Still blocked until confirmFinalize succeeds.
- Confirmed (confirmation file written): Mutations allowed (subject to MCP_ENABLE_MUTATION rules).
- Existing Workspace (any non-bootstrap instruction present): Treated as implicitly activated; confirmation optional.

Safety & Errors:
- Block response shape: { error:'mutation_blocked', reason:'bootstrap_confirmation_required' }.
- Expired token: { error:'token_expired' }.
- Invalid token: { error:'invalid_token' }.
- No pending token: { error:'no_pending_token' }.
- Reference mode block: reason='reference_mode_read_only'.

Renewal: If token expires before use, request a new one via 'bootstrap/request'.

Do NOT brute force tokens; rate/bulk attempts may be treated as abuse defense signals.
semanticSummary: Bootstrap activation steps with confirmation token gating mutations
